answer:
Yes. Your daughter can get vaccinated for free at your local health unit. You can find the contact information for your local health unit here.  We recommend that you call to make an appointment as soon as possible to prevent further delay with her immunizations.
You can find B.C.'s vaccine schedule of infants and young children here.
Immunization Nurse

question: My husband and I are permanent residents in BC. My daughter (9m old) was born in Denmark and not a Canadian citizen. We are living in BC. My daughter's PR application is in process and I believe she will get it early 2020. Can she get free vaccination now? She didn't have Hepatitis B vaccination.
question_variation_0: can my daughter get hepatitis free vaccine now
question_variation_1: will daughter receive hepatitis b vaccine
question_variation_2: can hepatitis b vaccinations be resisted in canada
